In collaboration with 
<span style="background-color:#d0e2ff; padding:4px 8px; border-radius:6px;">Rutgers RWJMS</span>, 
<span style="background-color:#ffe6cc; padding:4px 8px; border-radius:6px;">Tulane School of Medicine</span>, 
<span style="background-color:#d6f5e3; padding:4px 8px; border-radius:6px;">West Virginia University</span>, and 
<span style="background-color:#f3e8ff; padding:4px 8px; border-radius:6px;">Carnegie Mellon University</span>,  
we developed an end-to-end deep learning pipeline for detecting Giant Cell Arteritis (GCA) from digitized histopathological slides.

GCA is a serious vascular condition that can cause irreversible vision loss if not diagnosed and treated early. Temporal artery biopsy (TAB) is the gold standard for diagnosis, but the manual review process is time-consuming and susceptible to under-sampling. Our solution enables rapid triage by identifying diagnostically relevant Regions of Interest (ROIs) from whole-slide scans using a ResNet-based model trained on thousands of manually labeled patches.

<span style="background-color:#f3e8ff; padding:4px 8px; border-radius:6px;">Project Timeline: July 2022</span>

### Key Outcomes

- Achieved **92.32% accuracy** and **0.93 AUC** on a held-out test set, using a ResNet-34 model.
- Validated ROI-level accuracy of **96.32%** on the internal validation set.
- Enabled **real-time inference** with processing speeds under 170 ms per batch (16 ROIs).
- Used GradCAM to visualize attention over pathologist-confirmed lymphocytic and macrophage regions.
- Presented the work at **ARVO 2023**, and the full manuscript is **under review at NEJM**.

### My Contributions

- Built a complete image processing and tile extraction pipeline using `OpenSlide`, `PIL`, and `NumPy`.
- Managed a multi-institutional dataset of 3,500+ ROIs from 472 biopsy cases across 20 years.
- Evaluated and benchmarked model architectures including `ResNet-18`, `34`, and `50`.
- Integrated `GradCAM` for explainability and collaborated with clinical pathologists for validation.
- Handled IRB-compliant metadata processing and standardized naming across hospital systems.
- Collaborated across institutions to align data formats, ground truth labels, and evaluation criteria.

This project is a step toward democratizing access to high-quality, AI-assisted diagnostic tools in pathology labs. By surfacing diagnostically relevant areas instantly, it allows human pathologists to focus their review, saving hours per case and reducing false negatives. The pipeline generalizes well across patients and time, making it a potential blueprint for applications in **Takayasu arteritis**, **sarcoidosis**, and other vascular pathologies with patchy presentation.
